qas.question: The Royal Dutch Shell Group was created through the merger of which two rival companies?

answers.text: the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company of the Netherlands and the "Shell" Transport and Trading Company Ltd of the United Kingdom

qas.question: What was the main reason for the creation of the Royal Dutch Shell Group?

answers.text: the need to compete globally with Standard Oil

qas.question: In what year was the Royal Dutch Shell Group created?
In what year was the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company founded?
Why was the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company created?

answers.text: to develop an oilfield in Sumatra

qas.question: When was the Samuel brothers' father's antique company created?
What was the name of Marcus Samuel's father's antique company?

context: In February <a2_0>1907<a2_0/>, the Royal Dutch Shell Group was created through the amalgamation of two rival companies: <a0_0>the Royal Dutch Petroleum Company of the Netherlands and the "Shell" Transport and Trading Company Ltd of the United Kingdom<a0_0/>. It was a move largely driven by <a1_0>the need to compete globally with Standard Oil<a1_0/>. The Royal Dutch Petroleum Company was a Dutch company founded in <a3_0><b5_0>1890<b5_0/><a3_0/> <a4_0>to develop an oilfield in Sumatra<a4_0/>, and initially led by August Kessler, Hugo Loudon, and Henri Deterding. The <b8_0>"Shell" Transport and Trading Company<b8_0/> (the quotation marks were part of the legal name) was a British company, founded in 1897 by Marcus Samuel, 1st Viscount Bearsted, and his brother <b6_0>Samuel Samuel<b6_0/>. Their father had owned an antique company in Houndsditch, London, which expanded in <b7_0>1833<b7_0/> to import and sell sea-shells, after which the company "Shell" took its name.
